alert.note: Alert for Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:07PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Warren, south central Monroe and northeastern Northampton Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 607 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Belfast, or 8 miles north of Easton, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Belfast, East Bangor, Roxburg, Roseto, Stockertown and Portland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
